name: Kanda Poha
history: Kanda Poha is a popular Maharashtrian breakfast dish, often served as a quick snack as well. It's made from flattened rice (poha) and flavored with onions (kanda) and spices.
description: Kanda Poha is a light yet filling dish made from flattened rice, sautÃ©ed with onions, green chilies, mustard seeds, and turmeric. It's often garnished with fresh coriander and lemon juice.

instructions.title: Prepare Poha
instructions.description: Rinse the poha in a strainer under running water until it softens. Drain and set aside.

instructions.title: Cook the Seasoning
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Then add chopped onions, green chilies, and curry leaves. SautÃ© until the onions turn translucent.

instructions.title: Add Poha
instructions.description: To the pan, add turmeric powder and salt. Mix well. Then add the softened poha and sugar. Stir gently to mix everything together.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Turn off the heat, add lemon juice and garnish with chopped coriander. Serve hot.

tips: Ensure the poha is not over-rinsed; it should be moist but not mushy.
Adjust the green chilies and sugar according to taste.
variations: Add peanuts or cashews for a crunchy texture.
Include vegetables like peas, carrots, or potatoes for a more filling dish.

storage.shelfLife: Kanda Poha is best enjoyed fresh but can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on a stovetop until warm.
presentationTips: Serve on a plate with a side of fresh slices of cucumber or tomato.
